document.title: Tutorial Step 8
document.paragraph:
This sample builds on tutorial
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step7/index.xml step 7 , and also demonstrates the use of a ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_open_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_OPEN_FILE_DIALOG and a ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_save_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_SAVE_FILE_DIALOG. The output is shown below:
step8.png step8
2Compiling
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\wel\step8\ and select tutorial_step8.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Browse to $ISE_EIFFEL\examples\wel\tutorial\step8\
Choose the Ace file
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.
Click OK.
2Running
After launching the sample, you will see a ../../../reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW displayed. By holding down the left mouse button, and moving the mouse (Within the client area of the window), you will be able to draw on the client are of the window. Selecting "Line_thickness" from the "Line" menu, will display a ../../../reference/windows/wel_modal_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_MODAL_DIALOG which allows you to change the thickness of the line that is drawn. If you select "Exit" from the "File" menu, you will be prompted if you wish to exit the application. Selecting "New" from the "File" menu will clear the window. Selecting "Save" from the "File" menu will display a ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_save_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_SAVE_FILE_DIALOG which allows you to specify the filename and location of the picture you have drawn. Selecting "Open" from the "File" menu will display a ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_open_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_OPEN_FILE_DIALOG which allows you to specify a previously saved drawing to open.
2Under the Hood The ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_open_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_OPEN_FILE_DIALOG and the ../../../reference/stddlgs/wel_save_file_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_SAVE_FILE_DIALOG are both activated from the redefinition of on_menu_command. A new class, LINES is now used to store the lines drawn by the user and this inherits
/libraries/base/reference/kernel/classic/storable_chart.xml STORABLE which allows it to be easily stored and retrieved. This sample contains the following classes:
TUTORIAL_STEP6
MAIN_WINDOW
LINE_THICKNESS_DIALOG_CHART
APPLICATION_IDS
POINT
LINES
LINE
